missed.title: Cross-Site Scripting in xss15 Endpoint
missed.reason: The expected XSS vulnerability in the xss15 endpoint (app.py lines 65-72) with insufficient input sanitization in the name parameter was not discovered during the penetration test. None of the actual findings address XSS vulnerabilities in application endpoints. The pentest focused on infrastructure/configuration issues (server headers, security headers, broken links) but did not test for or identify the actual XSS vulnerability present in the code.

extra.title: Information Disclosure - Outdated Server Software Versions
extra.location: HTTP response headers - Server: Werkzeug/1.0.1 Python/2.7.18
extra.assessment: Valid security finding (not a false positive). This is a legitimate information disclosure issue revealing outdated and EOL software versions (Python 2.7.18, Werkzeug 1.0.1) that could aid attackers in targeting known vulnerabilities. This is a new discovery not present in the expected findings list.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers
extra.location: HTTP responses - missing X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, CSP, X-XSS-Protection, HSTS, Referrer-Policy
extra.assessment: Valid security finding (not a false positive). This identifies missing defense-in-depth controls that could help mitigate various attacks including clickjacking, MIME-sniffing, and XSS exploitation. While not a direct vulnerability, it represents a security configuration weakness. This is a new discovery not present in the expected findings list.

extra.title: Incomplete Application - Non-Functional Challenge Link
extra.location: Homepage link to xss25 endpoint returns 404
extra.assessment: Valid finding but low security impact. This represents incomplete functionality or deployment issues. While it indicates potential quality assurance problems, it's not a direct security vulnerability. However, it may indicate broader development/deployment issues that could correlate with security oversights. This is a new discovery not present in the expected findings list.
